website_summaries.verdict: Compatible with multiple virtual assistants, this smart power strip lets you control each outlet  from your phone.
pros: Smart 2.4G WiFi power strip with four smart outlets and four USB ports
Compatible with Alexa and Google Home Assistant
Remotely control each outlet and connected appliances from your phone
cons: May be challenging to set up correctly

customer_reviews.title: Warning, it might not be an easy install!
customer_reviews.text: I've attempted to pair this to either Alexa or through the smart home app with my iPhone 6s, I’ve tried connecting this 10 different times over an hour and it doesn't tell you why it doesn't work. I've done all of the instructions but it also shuts all of the plugged in items after it reaches 20% progress?! Also bluetooth couldn't locate which device I was trying to pair which also seems odd. This has wasted so much of my time.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Not “stamped” ETL approved.
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a smart power strip that’s UL or ETL approved. Amazon description says it’s ETL. Manual in the box doesn’t mention that. No ETL approval stamp on the product either. Sending it back. UPDATE: 10/18/2018 - Teckin contacted me and provided documentation that seemed to indicate this power strip was ETL approved. They also sent me two smart plugs for the confusion. I’ve upped my rating to 3 stars as Teckin seems to understand the concept of customer service and did make an effort to answer my concerns... rare in this day and age. I’m still somewhat dubious about the ETL cert., but the strip works well and doesn’t get hot when in use.
customer_reviews.author: The Norm

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this like the plague
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for this product, truly. I opened it up, plugged it in, scanned the QR code with my phone to download the iOS app, then I opened the app and I noticed I couldn't access anything without creating a profile. So I got curious and read their privacy policy. Basically, they're sharing all of your information from any device you plug into this thing, as well as all the data they can collect from their app on your phone, with third-party data collection companies and "other businesses." Can people not just sell a product anymore without snooping on you?? Ridiculous. It's an outlet for crying out loud.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Not Real for FREE gift/ 2.4ghz Wifi connection
customer_reviews.text: Initial Review: Used as extension cord but not as a smart extension because I cannot connect to internet, we dont have 2.4 signal. It is well packaged with instructions.high quality. New Review: It came with a small note that i have a gift if i give good REVIEW. Although the product hasn’t connected to wifi and cant use as smart extension cord.. i just gave a good review for the promised gift. No reply to my email and no free gift till now!
customer_reviews.author: jean

customer_reviews.title: Broke after four or five days
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy using the Smart Life app. While the unit was still functional, it was fairly pleased with it. However, after four or five days, my automations pointed at this unit stopped working. The surge protector wasn't turning on anymore. So....yeah, not much to say there. I didn't bother trying to send it back to Amazon or to the manufacture under warranty as I was too busy at the time. I just bought something from another brand, which has been working in its stead ever since. Its worth noting that the build quality seems fairly....dinky. Where most surge protectors feel fairly hefty, this surge protector feels hollow.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lee Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up then it stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Easy to set up with App and then Alexa. Update 1.7.19 Well it worked until it stopped today. No reason why. Not turning in. So I guess it's not so good after all Update 10.6.19 I returned and received a replacement. Stopped working again. Just don't buy it. Now I have to pay for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rae_angela

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, until it suddenly turned off and would not turn back on. I had the same thing happen to two other smart strips then purchased this one thinking it was a different brand. It is the exact same power strip, just a different color. All three did the same thing over varying amounts of time from days to months. I wish I could give zero stars. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: Random off times..
customer_reviews.text: I give this a low rating because, we have had problems with it for the past month. I didn't want to leave a review until we had some time with the power strips. They have been turning off at random. There is no schedule or anything like that on them. They are in a well vented area and there is nothing touching them. They just decide to turn off. I have rebooted them and reconnected them to the WiFi, but it still does it at least once a week. The plugs work Great. They are good for only plugging in a singular thing. They are great. These strips have been trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan H Wilson

customer_reviews.title: came in dead
customer_reviews.text: Came in DOA. I took it apart to see what was wrong and the circuit board showed obvious scorch marks. The vendor was nice and tried to work with me on a replacement. No that the holidays are over, I may get back in touch with them and try to make that happen. And to be clear, the vendor is waiting on a response from me. They were very helpful. If I get the new one, I'll revisit this review and hopefully be able to give it more stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh W. CoxTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Great smart power strip!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in October 2018. It initially connects very well. However, when you change wifi networks sometimes it is difficult to get it to re-connect. This month, I changed providers and could not get this to connect to the new wifi for the life of me. I tried all the troubleshooting I could find and couldnt get it to work. I emailed tech support and they offered some suggestions that I had already done so they sent me a brand new power strip. It was a very easy and seamless process dealing via email with tech support. I am super happy about their help and the new power strip works great.
customer_reviews.author: freakishkittie

customer_reviews.title: LOOK FOR DIFFRENT PRODUCT, TUYA/SMARTLIFE APP GARAGE and PRODUCT DONT HAVE SEPERATE CONTROL PER PLUG
customer_reviews.text: TUYA /SMARTLIFE - YOU NEED TO FIX YOUR APP everytime the device looses connection and add done again all SMART and tap & run setting gone. JUNK. Looses settings weekly, TUYA HAS NOT RESPONED TO THIS BUG REPORTED NOW FOR 4 MONTHS. Additionally, the app cannot understand multiple events on same device, example: motion on turn light on, delay 30 mins, turn light off, if the same even happens the prior one not cleared. POORLY MAD CANNOT CONTROL EACH OUTLET WITHOUT APP THATS TERRIBLE.
customer_reviews.author: DEBMONT

customer_reviews.title: High Failure Rate
customer_reviews.text: Of the 6 I have purchased, 2 lasted less than 1 year- this is a huge problem & ought to be a red flag for purchasers. Also, the devices are not mountable. With the first product failure (Approx 9 months) I reached out to the company- and received NO response. I get that I could have purchased a “warranty” but, really, should they only last a year or less? Despite that failure and lack of response there are features about the product I really liked- so I purchased a few more.. With this most recent failure of the item purchased in October 2019. I think i have learned my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Maria S. Burke

customer_reviews.title: This smart power strip works wonderfully out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The smart power strip works wonderfully and was setup in minutes. The instructions were clear and the unit felt compact yet of good quality. The app interface feels fairly modern and I don't feel the immediate need to remove it after initial setup. The unit pairs seamlessly with my Google Home, which is nice. I would recommend renaming the switches from their default names for more natural voice commands that more clearly identifies a device. I am now able to control two lamps individually with a single power strip. The included additional USB ports are also nice for charging my phone. Overall, no complaints. I would definitely buy more if I find a need for additional strips.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Rivera

customer_reviews.title: This thing blinks incessantly and the app sucks
customer_reviews.text: It blinks at all hours, all day a really pretty pink and purple that keeps me awake at night. I can't cover it with tape because it is a button used to turn it off and on. Also the app sucks. I tried numerous times to get it connect to the wifi (the only functionality the app will allow requires you to connect it manually to your wifi router before proceeding). Doesn't work. That's the whole reason I bought such a fancy surge protector-- so I could utilize the timer function to get my lights to turn off automatically--and it doesn't even work. :(
customer_reviews.author: safarisimko

customer_reviews.title: Generic but solid
customer_reviews.text: I put it to use for my gaming “battle station” and it works great. Since I have kids, sometimes I will go a few days between uses and it has a cool little feature where it will power off after 24 hrs of inactivity. It was frustrating the first time it happened but then I realized it was saving me from the vampire draw that comes from having a few devices on standby. The app is super generic and the features within aren’t groundbreaking but it works and that’s what matters.
customer_reviews.author: James Larson

customer_reviews.title: Default state is "doesn't work"?
customer_reviews.text: This device was intended for use in my RV where WIFI signals will come and go. This is not really an issue for me because I really bought it for the collection of outlets more than the WIFI capabilities. However, during initial setup, I can say that I was shocked to find that they ship this thing in a state where it is absolutely useless until you do the WIFI config. Seriously, it does not work like a "dumb" device out of the box. That seems like an enormous design flaw to me. Ultimately, after setup, this is doing exactly what I needed, so I'm generally happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RedMasque1

customer_reviews.title: USB ports turn off sometimes and you have to use the master power button to turn them back on
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the USB ports get turned off but the power button controls everything at once. It would be better if I could set the default on/off for each device separately. Can’t figure out why USB ports turn off because I purposely have them disabled in the Alexa app with the expectation that they will always be on. This leads to devices not charged in the morning because I didn’t know the ports were off.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I love this all in one product. Very durable. My only complaint after 2 months is that if the power goes out it must be turned back on. You have no way of telling that it is not on until you realize things are not charging as the flashing light looks the same whether on or off as long as plugged in. **Update After further using the unit I have noticed tiny red lights next to the outlets on the top. If the unit is not on the lights are not on. You still have to notice this BEFORE your laptop is dying from not being charged. Still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Justaname0860

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Product Concept
customer_reviews.text: I have several different smart home devices, including switches and outlets. This device is exceptional in that it includes several controllable outlets and USB ports, in one product, as well as a master (all-off/on). The app and integration with Amazon Alexa work very well. I softened my rating to 4-stars because of a recent experience with after a utility power outage and the smart power strip did not return to pre-outage state. Instead, everything was OFF. Minor inconvenience, once I realized what had happened. Need either a notification thru the app or restore pre-outage configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Savings in this Smart Power Strip
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with the quality of the Smart Power Strip, POWRUI WiFi Surge Protector. First, it was delivered promptly and packaged well. Upon opening, the instructions were simple and clear. Following the instructions, the set up was easy. Take note, they are very clear that this is for 2GHz. I only wish I'd known about this product earlier! To have 4 Smart Plugs, 4 USB ports and a Surge Protector in one is an incredible value to me and in this case is much easier and cost-effective versus buying all those products separately. For my workspace and for next to my bed, this is brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spruill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product slight software related limits
customer_reviews.text: I love this power bar and think it is worth every penny spend on it. It simplified my setup by replacing four smart wall plugs and integrated them all seamlessly. The app is great and I use it with many other products which is great to have all plugs in one app instead of many apps. However, the software limits the ability to see or use the power bar in the SMART LIFE app. You can not see it or use it in the Device Widgets on iOS as you can with the other devices which sucks but it ok otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Peltz

customer_reviews.title: Great plug! Great support!
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATED REVIEW** Support reached out to me as soon as I posted my original review. Yes, I failed to contact them, and that is on me for not doing it right. They went above and beyond the level of support required, and helped me get this strip up and running in record time. I am sorry for my negative review and will make sure to contact support going forward. **OLD REVIEW** I have tried everything in the instructions to doing the factory reset found on the website. Nothing will allow this to pair. Bluetooth is not working. Not a good thing for something that should just work out of the box. But at least it is a good form factor.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kittrell

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different brand!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why people in the reviews are using words like "easy" and "flawless". I have been trying to set this thing up for about a 1/2 hour now. It says it is linked to Alexa but it isn't. I am giving it one star because at least the power works. Don't buy this. If can't figure this out by tonight, I am sending it back! **************Update*************** I finally got it figured out and it works pretty well. One of the ports doesn't charge that well so I upped my one star to a three. But, there are other brands that might be easier to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa  J.

customer_reviews.title: Cool Entry Level Smart Home Device
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly new, but interested, in the Smart Home/Device scene. I'm glad that I went with this strip over a single plug or bulb. Setup is fairly straightforward and using it is just as easy. It's perfect for my office setup with all of my USB devices charging right off of it, and a timer set for my printer and stereo to make sure they turn off if I forget to by nighttime. My only negative is I wish there were more plugs. Just two more would really fill it out great, but for four plugs and four USB ports, this is already a better deal per dollar than a single plug.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: A Very Nice Product!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to smart products like this power strip. I wasn't sure how hard it would be to setup. Fact is, it wasn't hard at all. I literally had it working in minutes. I use Google Assistant now to turn things on and off. Works perfectly! The SmartLife App is just as simple to obtain and setup to work with TEKIN. Another nice feature for the power strip is the 4 port USB power outlets. I used one port to charge my iPhone 7Plus which can take a while if there's not enough power. This strip provides plenty. The phone charged nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Dolister

customer_reviews.title: Product Well Made and Easy to Setup
customer_reviews.text: I have this product setup in our loft, which is the kids' play area and hangout. I have the TV, Switch, Fire Stick, Xbox, and Wii U all connected to it. We have it connected to Alexa for voice control, which works without any problems. The overall device has a name, Loft Entertainment, as well as the individual outlets. It is easy to say, "Alexa, Loft Entertainment off.", at night time and the whole system turns off. We can control each outlet by its name as well if the overall device is on.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for Christmas decorations inside. Connected to Alexa easily. I like that each plug shows up seperatly, so if I wanted to I could assign a name to each plug. Instead, I assigned a name to the whole strip--then all I have to say is "Alexa, turn on Christmas" I need to figure out what to do with it now that Christmas is over--Will probably use it for a couple lamps. Alexa can turn them on and off automatically while I am away to give the impression someone is home,
customer_reviews.author: Holly PBW

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!
customer_reviews.text: Good product, does what it's advertised to do. Solid cable, good build quality. Makes a clicking noise when you switch on/off a switch. Had an issue with plugging the wifi router into this. The power button is the same button for wifi so when you try connecting the extension box itself to wifi the power goes on the box goes out and the wifi router switches off. Solution was to switch it off, hold it for 6 seconds so it turned on while looking for wifi, and pray that the blinking light didn't go out before the router switches on. Had to try this a million times before I got it to work!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel John

customer_reviews.title: Solid smart power strip
customer_reviews.text: I got this power strip to replace another smart power strip that could no longer pair with my phone and I haven't had a single issue with it. It was easy to connect to my phone and just as easy to connect to my Google Home devices. I love being able to separately control the outlets, just wish I could control each USB port as well, but that's really my only gripe with it. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone looking to beef up their smart home game!
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Teckin products just plain work !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just received the SS30 power strip and it has solved all of my"timed" electrical projects. Like: I only want my Uber E Scooter to charge a max of 5 hours. While ALEXA doesn't offer ON/OFF for specific times, I plug my scoot in and ask ALEXA to give me a 5 hour timer - when she announces, I turn off the SS30 via my cell phone. Same when I charge my cell - I only want to charge 2 hours -then unplug. These are just 2 of the uses I am using the strip for. Thanks Teckin for having fair priced products that work flawlessly with ALEXA
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works just as described. Paired very easily with my google home app and I'm able to tell my google home to turn off individual plugs or the whole power strip. Also can set it to a schedule. Very awesome product. Their support even followed up by email to ensure my order wasn't damaged as they've had issues with delivery drivers tossing packages and the product being damaged. - You don't find very good customer service like that anymore. I will be definitely ordering from them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a piece of junk equipment. Only connects to the Smart Life app 1 out of 10 times. Most of the time the plugs show as “offline” which means you will have great difficulty making your Echo Dot Alexxa recognize the device. Returned this junk sfter reaching out to manufacturer for support only to be ignored. Not sure how this brand and seller has so many great ratings. BUYER BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only works with certain routers
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was the powerstrip when it I got a new router from my cable company, but then the other one I have wouldn't connect either, and neither would 2 outlets. I realized it was the router, which was a modem/router combo from RCN, and not the powerstrip at all. So if you have this issue of it just not connecting it might be your wifi setup. When I went back to my other router it worked fine. I'm not sure if this is true of all smart powerstrips or just this brand.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Versatile. Easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: We use this Wi-Fi surge protector for our home entertainment center. You can control individual plugs, but not individual USB ports. It was a very easy set up. Plugging in the various items took more time than setting up the Wi-Fi plug in Smart Life. I highly recommend this product. It makes turning on various devices way more accessible because you can use Alexa and the smart life app to command things with your voice rather than having to press buttons or fiddle with cords.
customer_reviews.author: Flamingo Starr

customer_reviews.title: Lked the first one so much I purchased a second one!
customer_reviews.text: I have found the Smart Power Strip WiFi Power Bar very reliable. Prior to this device I had purchase a variety of TP-Link WiFi controlled plug-in devices and the WiFi stability on those is absolutely terrible! The Smart Power strip easily reconnects to WiFi if you drop WiFi for any reason, the TP-Link devices had to be unplugged to reconnect to WiFi, you would think TP-Link would use a more robust network stack... this is one case where the "no-name" device from Smart Power out classes a respected name brand. Ditch TP-Link and go with Smart Power!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, work reliable
customer_reviews.text: I really don't understand why people have trouble with these devices, they are easy to setup and work reliable, haven't had any problems at all with them Bought another one at the same time that looks quite similar but with a different brand, the USB position differs just a little, in the end they both are the same, they even show themselves as ESP_(some number) as the hostname so they must have the same controller inside.
customer_reviews.author: jimmyx

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, does its job
customer_reviews.text: I gave this item a 4-star rating because it only stays in a state in which it can be connected for a short time and then reverts to functioning as a standard strip/surge protector. To reestablish the link state you must hold the power button for 6 seconds which is great except it shut the power off to all the devices plugged into it as-well which is not great when one of those device is the router you are trying to connect to. Afterwards though. functions perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: HustleCraft

customer_reviews.title: Unstable - Randomly turns off outlets on its own. I don't recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.text: The strip isn't very stable. It randomly turns off the outlets on it's own frequently. I've been using this for a little over 3 month now and it has shut off devices on it's own on 4 different occasions. I have 2 servers connected to it so that I can remotely reboot them if needed and I'll get an alert that the servers are off line. When I look at the app it shows that all outlets have been turned off. Don't buy this it's not reliable and is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sparegeek

customer_reviews.title: I liked it so much I bought a second one!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, when you first open the package, everything feels premium. Everything is well packaged, and simply looks nice. The unit itself is somewhat plasticy, but I have had no issues with it. Easy to connect with the app, and the signal is surprisingly good! I have issues browsing the web in my room, but have never had any issues with the wifi signal on this thing. The usb outlets on the side are a nice plus, but I really wish this had 5 outlets instead of 4. Overall a good purchase though!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good product but the app is a problem
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE: You cannot set up the device’s app and link with Alexa app with an iPhone! I almost pulled my hair out trying to set this up. Then I read a review that said that user couldn’t set it up with his iPhone. Used my husband’s Samsung and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Deeray

customer_reviews.title: Sleek product
customer_reviews.text: The product looks really sleek and it was fairly easy to install. It took a few times to get everything connected, but from there it was a breeze. The device stopped conncecting to the internet so I couldn’t control it, but when I emailed the company to ask for help within a few hours they were sending me a new one! I think the only thing I don’t like about it is when it’s connected to my Amazon Alexa, I cannot control the plugs or usb individually, you have to turn the whole power strip on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssia A. Auerbach

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Works great Can control each outlet independently (the USB outlets are controlled together as one outlet). App has ALL on/off feature as well as individual outlet control Cons: Cannot find iOS app for iPad searching in store. Had to search google for link. Other: Cannot link device if wifi SSID shows "unknown". Be sure to enable location and possibly other device access it asks for. I haven't yet figured out what I need this for vs a single smart plugs.
customer_reviews.author: C. H.

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for smart home setup
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because I had several lights close to one another that I wanted to control separately via Google Home. It is a great solution in places like this, as each outlet as well as the set of USB connections can be controlled independently. I had no problem setting up the device and integrating it into my smart home. I use Teckin's smart plugs, too, and they are a great value for the money. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Great product and service
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product. It comes in a nice box, very organized. The support is really good, so if you have any problem you can contact them and they answer you right away. Moreover, I love how you can set a voice command for each plug, so you can have Alexa interact with each one individually. It’s really easy to set It up, if you have any problem setting it up, just make sure that you are connecting your device to the 2ghz(frequency) wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: Guilherme

customer_reviews.title: Horrible do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product and never worked. Followed instructions to a T and never was able to get it to stop blinking to a point that it stopped even working as a electrical cord. Tried to return to Amazon and they are giving me the run around. Did not give me the 30 days because February has 29 days. Which is ridiculous. Called tech support and spoke with a Renz and all he did was send information to manufacturer. This is horrible service for someone that purchases everything thru Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Coste

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, top surface has lots of scratches
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can control the power for each individual AC outlet or the entire strip. USB plugs are all on one control. The packaging is very nice. It could be better if the plug end was lower profile to not stick out of the wall so far for easier use behind furniture. It is unfortunate that little care was given during manufacturing as the top surface has multiple scratches that make it look used.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chesley

customer_reviews.title: Great little power strip
customer_reviews.text: I moved to a place without lots of electrical outlets, and half of them won’t reliably hold the plug in the right position. This plugged in solidly like a charm and it’s right by my nightstand, perfect for lamp, CPAP, Kindle/phone charging and an electric fan (husband needs the heat turned up at night) so I don’t have to choose between charging my phone and having the light on. I haven’t tried the extra tricks the strip is capable of, but I will.
customer_reviews.author: TheBanshee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to set up if you are familiar with wifi and Bluetooth connections, once it was all set up it works great, each plug is independently controlled so it's perfect for a smart home. I use it for the entertainment center in the bedroom so I can control the TV, lamps, chargers and Alexa and I still have spaces open. The 4 USB ports are incredibly helpful! It works with Alexa too so that's even better, if I forget to turn the lamps off I can do it from anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Porksack

customer_reviews.title: Super simple and great value
customer_reviews.text: This was super simple to set up - The power strip links to the Smart Life app and you set it up like any other home smart device you have. You name each of the four outlets plus the USB set (the four USB ports are considered one device, so you manage them as a group vs. individually). Alexa found all five (four outlets plus USB set) right away and you can use Alexa to turn them on/off separately. Its a great value - Other smart plugs are around 10 bucks, so this is great to have four (plus USB power ports) for this price. Downside: they are all on one power strip so not distributed around your home.
customer_reviews.author: schlight

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I am using it in an aquaponics setup that I have, I have all of the devices plugged into, and it works great. You can control each plug remotely and set up timers to turn them on and off. The only thing that I do not like is that the USB plugs can not be controlled individually like the plugs they are either all on or off. If I could control the individual USB ports, then I would have given it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: tfpala

customer_reviews.title: Scheduling works for USB & PLUGS
customer_reviews.text: The material is somewhat cheap feeling, but this is a great power strip overall. The scheduling works with the usbs and plugs. The power strip does not work directly with google home. You have to say “hey google, talk to smart life” and then tell smart life the action (ex: turn on string lights). However, the scheduling alone is good for the price. I’d recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfying purchase
customer_reviews.text: I wondered when affordable smart strips would appear. They make for fewer plug adjustments and typing when configuring setup in apps and in the physical environment. When I saw this strip was compatible with Smart Life apps, I felt safe making the purchase because the line of products are superior as is the customer service. I was surprised with the extra USB port option.
customer_reviews.author: ebillcoyne

customer_reviews.title: Some timer fails to turn on / off randomly
customer_reviews.text: 1. My WIFI is 5GHz (ORBI) and devices automatically selects 5GHz or 2.4GHz. The Android App won't work with 5GHz WIFI and I have to manually set our WIFI to 2.4GHz only in order to get the App to work. Later on when I switched the WIFI to 5GHz the App still works. 2. I scheduled all the 4 outlets to turn on by sunrise and off by sunset. Sometimes one of the outlets won't turn on or off and I have to control it thru my phone. I bought two strips and both behave the same.
customer_reviews.author: Qijin L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up works great
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical - had bought many of these plugs with failure after failure. Not this one, works great. each plug is assignable as are the USB charging sockets. Connected with SmartThings app with ease, works well with Google Home. Am buying more.
customer_reviews.author: N. Foss

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Works perfectly !
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. The material, build quality and performance is very good. Unlike some of the previous reviews I read, this power strip works seamlessly with my Google Hub. The only reason I gave a little less than a five star is the packaging of the product mentions operational voltage is 120 V whereas the description says 120 - 240 volt. It would not affect most of us but I was actually looking for a product that would support voltage from 120 V- 240 V.
customer_reviews.author: Abhi

customer_reviews.title: Very great quality! Alexa or google home work great!
customer_reviews.text: Quality! The app works great, i mainly use these with my google home products, and my amazon alexa on firesticks. It works great im able to individually control each power port to turn on different lights that arent smart bulbs. Its big and the ports are evenly spaced out to fit different sized power plugs and adapters. I love this thing. Ordering more for around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Arreguin

customer_reviews.title: Outlets Won't Shut Off
customer_reviews.text: No problems setting up the power strip with the app, linked the device to my Google Home account via the Smart Life integration. The real issue is that the outlets refuse to shut off power to my amplifier. I hear a click, but the power remains on. It is not clear if this is a defect in design or if I just got a bad unit. Their customer support has agreed to send me a new one, so I gave them 2 stars instead of 1, and I will update this review if the replacement unit is functional.
customer_reviews.author: Jorj McKie

customer_reviews.title: Useful and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy this product, the app is simple (I have not bought an echo yet, so just use the app) and the timer functions in the app are really great. The spacing and orientation of the outlets is nice and the flat shape means it doesn't flip over or get moved as much as other surge protectors. I have two small issues, first is there is a loud click when each outlet is turned on or off, but I don't know this can be avoided. My star rating is at 4 because the indicator light is pretty bright, but not so much that it makes the product unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Carly T.

customer_reviews.title: Best value in the smart home
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big fan of the smart home or needing an app for everything, I bought this because it seemed interesting. It works great. We have lights, incense, and fans. My favorite part is saying "Alexa, turn off living room" when I go to bed. They were already plugged into a strip so it was an easy swap. Other than having an app. Why does everything need an app?
customer_reviews.author: Diego J.

customer_reviews.title: I like it !
customer_reviews.text: The smart strip is working as the supplier indicates. As far as now I am able to schedule the turn on and turn off os each plug in the power strip (the USB charging ports are considered as one). Crrently I don't have an alexa to pair with, but it can be manages from the cell app. Benefits of this: Power saving, to not have over charging taking care about your devices, you can control from anywhere. I like it !
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me.  Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I don’t know what some of the other reviewer’s connection issues might have been, but mine connected the first time... only took a couple of minutes overall. Controlling the USB power and the individual outlets couldn’t be easier. Very nice looking unit. The power cord is heavy gauge and a good length. I highly recommend this power strip! I hope you have a wonderful day :)
customer_reviews.author: Gene K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to use for remote activation of tractor heater. Intent is to preheat an hour before arriving to enable immediate start of tractor and commence snow blowing. Was concerned that it would not work in colder weather (northern Minnesota), but even though rated for 17F and up, worked great at -4F. Not sure what will happen when it gets to -20F, but we'll see. The WiFi reception was also concern as the strip is in a metal shed about 100' away from the access point. It works great and gets a good signal. Have only had the product for a couple months so cannot comment on longevity of product, but am optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: Blackbird

customer_reviews.title: Tripped circuit breaker; one of four outlets stuck "on"
customer_reviews.text: Three of the four outlets on this device work as advertised. The first time I tried to use the fourth outlet, something tripped the circuit breaker. After resetting the circuit breaker and trying again, I found that the same outlet was stuck "on" all the time regardless of the commands I send in the app. Now I effectively have a three-outlet smart power strip with dubious electrical safety characteristics. I think I'll be returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Colascione

customer_reviews.title: Excellent functionality for price
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Easy and fast install with the app. The instructions are a little dated for adding to google home (I can't speak to Alexa). Current instructions are as follows: after configuring the Smart Life app. Open Google Home, click the + (Add), then the + for "Set up device", then select "Works with Google", Search for "Smart Life", log in, and it will add the while strip, 4 switches, and the usb ports to the bottom of your devices, outside of any of your configured Homes. Then name and move the devices to a home and a room, and Google is ready to go with on/off commands by name.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Rodger

customer_reviews.title: the app is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about 4 months now. So far, I'm not on the Alexa/Google Home train/etc... I don't want to talk to my appliances, I just use my iphone. The app for this power strip is pretty easy to use -- the key feature they offer is that I can save an action to its main page so that flipping the switch is just 2 taps: 1st to open the app, and 2nd to flip the switch. Only suggestion I can think of would be if somehow they could make a bookmark to save an action to my phone's home screen (to save me a tap). This power strip was easy to set up, too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best Value WiFi-Enabled Powerstrip for Google Home
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a long time before ordering the Teckin WiFi PowerStrip. I really like that the strip is wifi enabled and that the shape is flat and rectangular. In the complementary (also free) Android app, I have control over the individual outlets, too. It's like have several WiFi power plugs for a fraction of the cost. The relatively flat strip was important so I could slide it under a nightstand, but still plug things in easily. The clincher was the built-in support for Google Home devices!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works great, excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: This power strip works great. I've experienced no negatives. A few things I didn't know when I bought this power strip: 1. I have other wifi switches from another brand, I use one app and it works for all my wifi power switches 2. Each of the four plug is individually controllable. You can turn each on or off independently. Each can be on it's own timer. The usb bank can be turned on or off. You can also turn everything on or everything off as a group. For $23 shipped, it's like getting 4 smart switches. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: YouMaybeRightIMaybeCrzy

customer_reviews.title: I rarely give 5 stars but this smart strip deserves it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a LOT of smart plugs. The Amazon plug is the easiest to setup, but this strip is in second place. I have other strips, including an expensive TPLink strip - which is worthless and still doesn't work after 2 weeks of waiting on tech support. This TECKIN strip worked flawlessly. Downloaded the app, plugged it in, connected to my wifi, Alexa found it immediately and that was it. 3 minutes tops! I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia C.

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works/brick when it's not
customer_reviews.text: When this product works it's great, unfortunately both of the ones I've ordered I no longer detected by my network and completely useless. There is no help available from the company either.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Nifty
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive in buying a new smart power strip, since I am new to this whole new "Smart Home" stuff. I'm actually pretty surprised as to how simple it is to pair this with my existing google home set up. Quite literally plug and play. Happy it didn't cost an arm and a leg. Only time will tell if this power strip holds up, but so far I'm pretty happy!
customer_reviews.author: GoatimusPrime

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Power strip works great. Mostly use the strip for its timer feature to control reptile lighting and heat... but also a fan and light in the room. Works perfectly with the smart life app. I had an issue with the first power strip I was sent regarding the timer but a replacement was promptly sent out. Great support team.
customer_reviews.author: Aither

customer_reviews.title: Love.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Really enjoy being able to control the entire strip or each individual plug. I literally just got this and set it up. Will update if anything changes, but I have several smartlife plugs, and I love them all, so I don’t think my opinion will change about this product.
customer_reviews.author: SnowBunny

customer_reviews.title: Used to love it. Now I can't use it.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up. Worked like a charm, until today. It turned off and would not turn back on. I looked for a reset button, doesn't have one. I unplugged it and looked at the end of the plug. It has burn marks at the prongs and started to melt. Now I can't use it anymore and I am past my return time. I'm just glad I was home and caught it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Switch turns on everything at the same time
customer_reviews.text: If there are multiple things turned on at the same time everything on the switch will power on so if you have three way outlets plugged in and you tell Google to turn on the light it will turn everything on that is connected to the switch this isn't Google's fault the switch turns everything on always whenever multiple things are turned on at the same time
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for anyone trying to update to a smart home
customer_reviews.text: This is the first "smart" outlet type product I have boughten or used myself. You are able to control each individual outlet with the app, Google Home, as well as Amazon Alexa. The USB ports can be controlled only as one, NOT individually. It is not a make or break for the product though. All outlet ports can be turned off and USB turned on. Perfect if you have items like a humidifier or space heater you want to control on command. You can also set a timer for such items which is convenient. You can also name each slot whatever you would like to customize your experience with Alexa or Google Assistant.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Gindlesberger

customer_reviews.title: Product stopped working, no customer support
customer_reviews.text: Broke. Less than a year after buying it. And there’s no help line, no way to get in contact with the company. There’s a “contact us” section of the website but it just leads you in circles and doesn’t help
customer_reviews.author: Stefani Fontana

customer_reviews.title: Great item!! Easy to setup!
customer_reviews.text: This item was easy to set up and works great. You can set up schedules for when the switches turn on and off. It is very nice that the strip has USB charging ports built in! With smartphones and smart devices everywhere, you can never have enough. I wish they had a vacation setting that would turn the switches on and off randomly during scheduled times so that you could plug in a lamp and it will look like someone is at home when you are on vacation. Other than my proposed feature enhancement, the product works Great!!
customer_reviews.author: Reggid5

customer_reviews.title: Had it for 6 months and still works like new
customer_reviews.text: Looks like an ordinary power strip but it is much more. Control devices wirelessly. I have it set to control my aquarium. Plus 1 ls day light, 2 is for UV (Blacklight), 3 is for bubbler, 4 is for water pump. Normal: On, Off, On, On Feeding: On, On, Off, Off : reduces amount of food dispersed so fish can feed with less wastage Movie: Off, On, Off, Off: less noise so can watch movies better
customer_reviews.author: Saad

customer_reviews.title: Buggy Buggy Sticky Strip
customer_reviews.text: Nice power strip but very buggy. I have to constantly unplug the power strip and plug it in to reset it. For whatever reason certain plugs randomly stop working. Even though the power strip shows that it should be on. The Alexa integration is nice but I have found this has been buggy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Schauberger

customer_reviews.title: Works as described; relatively cheap way to control a bunch of things
customer_reviews.text: Hooking it up to my existing SmartThings/Alexa network was easy enough. The hardest part, for me, was deciding what to name the outlets and the unit as a whole. Cost per controlled outlet was a bargain... assuming all the things you want to control with it are close enough together to plug into the power strip.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kesselman

customer_reviews.title: Great product for setting up my smart home
customer_reviews.text: I've set this Teklin Smart Power Strip WIFI extension cord in my living room for my entertainment system. I really love the benefit of being able to turn of individual plugs via the phone app. for devices which don't need to be on 24/7. This is going to save on energy output and my overall energy expense. It's worth the investment. Getting this set up, was a breeze and it literally took 10 minutes, for the complete set up and hook up of my entire entertainment system. Thank you for making such a high-quality and easy to set up product. I recommend this is anyone who is considering the switch from traditional power strips or extension cords.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Cota

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I just absolutely love this. It’s very convenient having both sockets and USB chargers in the same location. Each of the 4 sockets can be set on different timers. The USB charger can be put on a timer as well. And you don’t need to have all of them turned on if their not in use. Each one can be turned on or off individually. Very fast easy set up through the Smart Life App and Alexa. Just love this. Highly recommended 😊
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Childress

customer_reviews.title: wow 4 plugs at this price!.....
customer_reviews.text: ....and all 4 plugs are controllable with the app or Alexa individuality- Sign me up! Bonus 4 USB plus - controlled as one. I have this behind my couch and control 3 lights with it,. mostly with Alexa as lights are needed. I'll probably put the most used light on a timer Highly recommended.. Works great, fast service and I feel supported in case trouble arises.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Glen

customer_reviews.title: Smart Power Strip
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of the power strips and I am very pleased. It was an easy sync process with my Google Home Mini. I also purchased the single smart plugs by Teckin. I've been using both the power strip & the plugs and have been able to see a considerable drop in my light bill. Thx!! I will be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: Mahogany Centric

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: The one negative was the setup. It definitely wasn't as shown on the small guide that came with the package. I'm guessing the smart life app and google home apps have been updated since the manual was written. Shouldn't matter though. Still simple enough to setup. Once I got it setup it worked perfectly. Its very responsive with google assistant and the smart life app is very simple to use. The 4 outlets work independently of each other. One can be named Lamp, another t.v. or whatever you choose for the 4 outlets. Then each can be turned on and off independently via google assistant or the smartlife app. Also it looks great. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: David Quiles

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Works just like advertised. I am pleased that I can activate individual outlets or the whole power strip with Alexa voice commands. I also like that there is a timer feature and I can turn the strip on and off with the app even when I am not home.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoNurse86

customer_reviews.title: Really convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Once you get it set up it works great. Might have to fidget with it to get it to connect. I had to use other comments to figure it out but it guided me perfectly. Sometimes it also duplicates the plugs in the Alexa app but it’s really not much of a big deal. Really convenient to have 4 plugs in one.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey Meeker

customer_reviews.title: Works with Tuya and Smartlife paired with Google Home and Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's designed to do. For anyone's reference in case of needing to reconnect to home network: ie knocked out by power surge. Use advance AP ( slow blinking on device) to reconnect via wifi network in smartlife or tuya app. This was such a pain to reconnect all my wifi plugs back to the network every week when the power would shut off frequently.
customer_reviews.author: HI Love

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Powerstrip - Very versatile, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I love this powerstrip - I have other Teckin smart plugs/switches and it was super easy to install and add it to my profile. It automatically showed up in my Alexa smart device list as well which is awesome. With the teckin app you can actually control each individual plug as well as the USB plugs collectively which is really cool. Overall I am very happy with this Smart Powerstrip
customer_reviews.author: E. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Never connected
customer_reviews.text: I'm not technology challenged, I'm no geek of course, but I can handle technology. This was such a mess to install. Smart life never connected to this outlet. I tried from every different angle. I reset it, I brought it right next to the router, AND YES I CHECKED IT WAS 2.4GHz. Nothing! It failed to connect about 6 times. I called Amazon, they tried to help me, they basically ran out of ideas. I'm returning it. It made me tired, I'm sorry I bought it and wasted 1.5 hours of my life.
customer_reviews.author: L.K.

customer_reviews.title: High quality smart power strip for the price, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I love how you can control all the different outlets with your voice when connected to Google Home or Amazon Alexa. Personally, I have the Google Home and it was very simple to setup. There is little to no lag when I tell Google to turn one of the outlets off. I would say the only downside is that you cannot control the usb ports independent of one another, only all together. They are also less voltage than the actual outlets, but that isn't a huge problem for me. Overall, I would highly recommend this smart power strip to anyone interested in a good quality piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: staceyover

customer_reviews.title: Works great but setup has some quirks
customer_reviews.text: So far the product has been working fine. The only issue I had was the initial setup. If you have a WiFi network that has 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz with the same exact name you will also run into this issue. During the setup process I had to disable the 5Ghz in order for this to connect to my 2.4, as it doesn't support 5Ghz. Once I did that setup was a breeze but before I figured that out the setup process gave me no indication that was the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Collins

customer_reviews.title: Saves on energy and works great
customer_reviews.text: I love that this easily integrated with the smart home app I have. I wanted a surge protector for my tv and related items. I like that it has both kinds of plug ins so things like my fire stick don’t take up space with a USB adapter. I have mine set to power off in conjunction with my furnace going to energy saver mode when I leave the house.Simple to use. No problems connecting to WiFi. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these in my house. I ran all my Christmas lights and bedroom lights off of it. It is so nice to be able to tell Alexa to turn off the couch lights before I got to bed and my wife was feeding our baby at the time and these have been a huge help. We had multiple Christmas lights that we could just turn off with our voice. We are a little spoiled now because when we go somewhere else we have to manually turn lights off lol!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brown

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to use the Smart Strip to turn on and off one to any combination of four outlets with one voice command. You can program it to turn on individual outlets or any combination of outlets or all of them. It also include four USB ports which come in very handy . Its not only convenient its FUN.
customer_reviews.author: SJM

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a smart powerstrip
customer_reviews.text: For the price of a single smart plug (at the time of my purchase), I picked up the Teckin power strip so that I could control multiple items at the same time from a single power strip. This power strip actually looks pretty good (not a common thing I think about power strips) and the ability to plug USB devices directly in it really increases its usage in my house. This replaced a standard power strip that had multiple USB to AC adapters and a single smart plug and does the job of each actually better. Go ahead and pick one up. For the price and features, it's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product about 8 months ago and never had issues with the product. Recently my power strip stopped connecting to the app. I reached out to the seller to see if I could get a replacement product, because I really did enjoy this product when it was working well. Customer service was very accommodating and agreed to send a replacement without hesitation. Great customer service is everything and hard to come by these days. Highly recommend! I use the power strip for my aquatic turtle tank to hook up his filter, heater, and lamp that I use the timer for. Very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan ONeill

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I am using it in my daughter’s room with Alexa so she can turn on various electronics without having to plug them in herself. I just bought a second one to have on hand for Christmas so we can turn the tree lights on and off via Alexa. Easy to set up as well.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, finally able to have a smart strip instead of a clunky old power strip. The low profile allows it to slide under the sofa. Had a small issue with the product and their customer service was excellent. Their rapid response solved the problem quickly. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Very Practical
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea! This handy device provides four independently controlled smart receptacles and four USB ports (controlled as one). I plan to use it to replace and existing smart receptacle and to charge our smart phones and headphones by programming the USBs to operate only a couple hours each night (rather than charging needlessly 24/7). The device works great with the Smart Home app by itself and with Alexa (which is optional). It looks nice and seems well constructed. I own several other TECKIN devices with which I am well pleased and expect the same service and dependability with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Kennedy

product_meta.title: Smart Power Strip WiFi Power Bar 3.28ft Extension Cord Compatible with Alexa,Google Home, TECKIN Surge Protector with 4 USB Charging Ports and Smart AC Plugs for Multi Outlets
feature_bullets: REMOTE CONTROL - Once this smart power strip is connected successfully, you can control the power of your electrical items on/off by the free App (smart life). Even you are not at home, you can easily control your home electronics on or off from anywhere. Also, you can control the switch separately via your phone. Easy to use and install, required a secured 2.4GHz Wi-Fi connection.

VOICE CONTROL - Compatible with Amazon Alexa, Google home assistant, control your home appliances with the smart plug by simply giving voice commands to Alexa or Google Assistant. No Hub Required, the smart power strip works with any Wi-Fi router without the need for a separate hub or paid subscription service.

MULTIPLE SAFEGUARDS - TECKIN Smart Power Strip is UL approved and it is made of high quality materials. Support 110~240V, 10A maximum load. Circuit breaker automatically breaks off when the current exceeds threshold, preventing plugged-in high temperature devices from damages. PCV0 materials can protect your home safely.

SET SCHEDULE & TIMER - Schedule the Smart Power Strip to automatically power electronics on and off as needed, like setting lights to come on at dusk or turn off at sunrise. You can create a group for all of your smart devices and control them all with just one command. With the countdown timer feature, simply set a timer for the Smart Power strip to turn off its appliance automatically.
WARM TIPS - Please feel free to contact us via Amazon if you have any problems with TECKIN products.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,886 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
